channel.title: Updaters using number of arguments as a property

item.title: Updaters using number of arguments as a property
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“solarwind, post:15, topic:188710”][quote author=unlimitedorb link=topic=251497.msg2107246#msg2107246 date=1205456557]

Is too easy! Just check the method that the dummy argument leads to.
[/quote]Exactly. If i weren’t so lazy i’d make an updater that stores 2 Hashmaps. One with a “clean” client to scan, and one to write the accessors onto.

If you remove the dumby code, what happens when the reflection engine invokes a method expecting to get a dumby result? Oh that’s right, you get caught. MY BAD.

Whoah whoah whoah, I don’t get what you’re saying here…[/quote]
he is implying you would use a method with the dummy arguments removed in a live client

Read full topic
item.source: Updaters using number of arguments as a property

item.title: Updaters using number of arguments as a property
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

its perdy easy, just do it “zkm style”, that is, methodXXXXXXXXX where XXXXXXXX is some number that is incremented with every method you visit

item.title: Updaters using number of arguments as a property
item.dc:creator: @solarwind solarwind
item.description:
@solarwind wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:8, topic:188710”][quote author=solarwind link=topic=251497.msg2107059#msg2107059 date=1205452155]
Obviously I’m going to give every method it’s own name.
[/quote]

its not a simple job, speljohan said it was easy, when frankly it isnt at all.[/quote]
Why do you say it isn’t easy at all? Well I’m going to try it anyway. If you could help, I would really appreciate it.

Read full topic

item.title: Updaters using number of arguments as a property
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:

solarwind:

Obviously I’m going to give every method it’s own name.

its not a simple job, speljohan said it was easy, when frankly it isnt at all.

item.source: Updaters using number of arguments as a property

item.title: Updaters using number of arguments as a property
item.dc:creator: @solarwind solarwind
item.description:
@solarwind wrote:

[quote=“unlimitedorb, post:6, topic:188710”][quote author=solarwind link=topic=251497.msg2106991#msg2106991 date=1205448756]

It’s not that hard to write a bcel routine that removes most dummy arguments though.

That’s what I’m doing.
[/quote]
Don’t, it is hard.

The arguments are added in order to change the signature so that methods can have the same name. Take a look at what you’re doing before you do it, if you do, you also have to refactor the name of the method or it will NOT work.[/quote]
Obviously I’m going to give every method it’s own name.

Read full topic
item.source: Updaters using number of arguments as a property

item.title: Updaters using number of arguments as a property
item.dc:creator: @unlimitedorb unlimitedorb
item.description:
@unlimitedorb wrote:

[quote=“solarwind, post:5, topic:188710”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=251497.msg2106966#msg2106966 date=1205447750]
It’s not that hard to write a bcel routine that removes most dummy arguments though.
[/quote]
That’s what I’m doing.[/quote]
Don’t, it is hard.

The arguments are added in order to change the signature so that methods can have the same name. Take a look at what you’re doing before you do it, if you do, you also have to refactor the name of the method or it will NOT work.

Read full topic

item.source: Updaters using number of arguments as a property

item.title: Updaters using number of arguments as a property
item.dc:creator: @solarwind solarwind
item.description:
@solarwind wrote:

[quote=“unlimitedorb, post:2, topic:188710”][quote author=solarwind link=topic=251497.msg2105478#msg2105478 date=1205373767]
I see a lot of this in updaters:

if((m.getModifiers() == (Constants.ACC_STATIC | Constants.ACC_FINAL)) && m.getReturnType() == Type.INT && m.getArgumentTypes().length == 1) {

Note the last bit, the number of arguments. I thought the obfuscator Jagex uses always changes the number of arguments and adds useless parameters to methods. Shouldn’t this throw off updaters? Maybe I’m wrong. Why is it being used as a pattern property if it changes all the time?
[/quote]

For the most part it adds one argument to every obfuscated method.[/quote]
Thanks, I’ll keep that in mind!

Read full topic
item.source: Updaters using number of arguments as a property

Note the last bit, the number of arguments. I thought the obfuscator Jagex uses always changes the number of arguments and adds useless parameters to methods. Shouldn’t this throw off updaters? Maybe I’m wrong. Why is it being used as a pattern property if it changes all the time?[/quote]

For the most part it adds one argument to every obfuscated method.
